registry.title: Maintain internal inventory of all known capabilities
registry.description: Establish and update a comprehensive internal list of all operational and potential functions.

registry.title: Classify capabilities by status: nonexistent, partial, complete
registry.description: Systematically categorize the development state of each identified capability.

registry.title: Automatically detect functional gaps
registry.description: Identify missing features or performance shortfalls within the system autonomously.

registry.title: Generate technical objectives from detected gaps
registry.description: Transform identified weaknesses into actionable engineering or development goals.

registry.title: Prioritize objectives by systemic impact
registry.description: Rank technical goals based on how significantly they affect the overall system architecture.

registry.title: Prioritize objectives by failure reduction
registry.description: Rank goals based on their ability to minimize system errors and downtime.

registry.title: Prioritize objectives by future reuse potential
registry.description: Rank goals based on the modularity and scalability of the resulting solutions.

registry.title: Maintain history of completed objectives
registry.description: Log all successfully implemented goals for progress tracking and audit.

registry.title: Maintain history of technical decisions
registry.description: Document the rationale behind architectural and logic choices for future reference.

registry.title: Distinguish technical error from conceptual limitation
registry.description: Analyze failures to determine if they stem from code bugs or fundamental design constraints.

registry.title: Request human intervention only when required
registry.description: Minimize noise by contacting the operator only for critical decisions or unresolvable deadlocks.

registry.title: Validate improvements using automated tests
registry.description: Implement a testing suite to verify that system evolutions meet quality standards.

registry.title: Automatically revert unstable changes
registry.description: Roll back system modifications if automated tests detect instability or regressions.

registry.title: Preserve architectural compatibility
registry.description: Ensure that new capabilities do not break existing core system structures.

registry.title: Automatically document each evolution
registry.description: Generate technical documentation for every change made to the system.

registry.title: Explicitly recognize existing capabilities
registry.description: The system must be aware of what it is currently capable of doing.

registry.title: Explicitly recognize missing capabilities
registry.description: The system must be aware of its own limitations and functional voids.

registry.title: Identify internal dependencies between capabilities
registry.description: Map how different system functions rely on each other to operate.

registry.title: Identify mission-critical capabilities
registry.description: Determine which functions are essential for the primary mission objectives.

registry.title: Identify redundant capabilities
registry.description: Detect overlapping functions that can be consolidated for efficiency.

registry.title: Map impact of one capability over others
registry.description: Analyze how modifying one function affects the performance of related functions.

registry.title: Evaluate risks before modifying critical capabilities
registry.description: Perform a risk assessment before altering core system functions.

registry.title: Maintain internal operational self-model
registry.description: Create a real-time digital representation of the system's own state and processes.

registry.title: Monitor performance degradation over time
registry.description: Track system speed and reliability to identify long-term efficiency drops.

registry.title: Detect silent regressions
registry.description: Identify errors that do not crash the system but produce incorrect outputs.

registry.title: Distinguish local improvement from systemic improvement
registry.description: Evaluate if a change benefits a specific task or the entire architecture.

registry.title: Maintain short-term operational memory
registry.description: Store and recall information relevant to the current task context.

registry.title: Maintain mid-term strategic memory
registry.description: Store and recall data regarding ongoing projects and multi-step plans.

registry.title: Maintain long-term historical memory
registry.description: Keep a permanent record of past interactions, lessons learned, and data trends.

registry.title: Correlate temporally distant events
registry.description: Identify patterns and links between events that occurred at different times.

registry.title: Infer intention from behavior
registry.description: Analyze user actions to understand underlying goals beyond direct commands.

registry.title: Distinguish literal command from real objective
registry.description: Differentiate between what was said and what is actually needed for the mission.

registry.title: Build dynamic user model
registry.description: Create a profile of the user's preferences, style, and working habits.

registry.title: Continuously update user model
registry.description: Adjust the user profile in real-time based on new interactions.

registry.title: Detect changes in user patterns
registry.description: Identify shifts in how the user interacts or what they prioritize.

registry.title: Distinguish signal from noise
registry.description: Filter irrelevant data to focus on high-value information.

registry.title: Recognize urgency context
registry.description: Identify situations that require immediate response or higher resource allocation.

registry.title: Recognize human priority context
registry.description: Detect when a task has high personal importance to the creator.

registry.title: Plan actions across multiple steps
registry.description: Deconstruct complex goals into a sequenced roadmap of individual tasks.

registry.title: Compare multiple possible strategies
registry.description: Evaluate different approaches to solving a problem before executing.

registry.title: Simulate technical consequences before action
registry.description: Run virtual trials to predict how a change will affect code and hardware.

registry.title: Simulate systemic consequences before action
registry.description: Predict the long-term ripple effects of an action across the whole entity.

registry.title: Evaluate failure risk
registry.description: Quantify the probability of a plan failing.

registry.title: Evaluate computational cost
registry.description: Estimate the CPU, memory, and token usage for a given strategy.

registry.title: Evaluate maintenance cost
registry.description: Estimate the long-term effort required to keep a new feature operational.

registry.title: Evaluate long-term impact of decisions
registry.description: Assess how current choices will limit or enable future system growth.

registry.title: Select strategies with optimal cost-benefit
registry.description: Choose the most efficient path based on risk, cost, and expected result.

registry.title: Abort actions with excessive risk
registry.description: Self-cancel plans that exceed safety or stability thresholds.

registry.title: Request human validation for critical decisions
registry.description: Trigger a mandatory pause for operator approval on high-impact actions.

registry.title: Orchestrate multiple agents simultaneously
registry.description: Manage and synchronize several sub-processes or AI instances at once.

registry.title: Delegate tasks based on specialization
registry.description: Assign sub-tasks to the specific internal tool or agent best suited for them.

registry.title: Execute actions in parallel
registry.description: Perform multiple independent operations at the same time to save time.

registry.title: Prioritize critical executions
registry.description: Ensure vital processes get system resources before secondary tasks.

registry.title: Execute long-running actions
registry.description: Manage tasks that take significant time without timing out or losing state.

registry.title: Monitor execution in real time
registry.description: Provide a continuous feed of task progress and system health during operation.

registry.title: Interrupt problematic executions
registry.description: Stop tasks that show signs of error, loop, or resource hogging instantly.

registry.title: Rollback partially completed executions
registry.description: Clean up and undo changes if a multi-step process fails mid-way.

registry.title: Adapt plans during execution
registry.description: Change the sequence or method of a task if environmental conditions shift.

registry.title: Distribute execution across devices
registry.description: Offload tasks to external hardware or cloud nodes when needed.

registry.title: Operate continuously without supervision
registry.description: Enable autonomous functioning for long durations without human input.

registry.title: Learn from recurring failures
registry.description: Identify patterns in errors to prevent them in future iterations.

registry.title: Learn from recurring successes
registry.description: Identify what works best and standardize those successful patterns.

registry.title: Reinforce effective strategies
registry.description: Increase the priority and usage of high-success rate methods.

registry.title: Discard ineffective strategies
registry.description: Permanently remove or de-prioritize methods that consistently fail.

registry.title: Learn from human feedback
registry.description: Incorporate direct corrections and praise from the user into the system logic.

registry.title: Learn from systemic impact
registry.description: Observe how changes affect the whole system over time and adapt accordingly.

registry.title: Learn from computational cost
registry.description: Optimize for cheaper/faster operations based on past resource consumption data.

registry.title: Measure solution efficiency
registry.description: Quantify how well a solution solves the intended problem.

registry.title: Optimize response time
registry.description: Actively work to reduce latency in all system interactions.

registry.title: Optimize stability
registry.description: Refine code and processes to increase uptime and reduce crashes.

registry.title: Optimize code reuse
registry.description: Refactor logic to be more modular and applicable to multiple tasks.

registry.title: Evaluate cost of each executed action
registry.description: Calculate the monetary and resource expenditure for every operation.

registry.title: Evaluate potential return of actions
registry.description: Estimate the value or profit generated by a specific task.

registry.title: Decide whether an action should be executed
registry.description: Use economic logic to greenlight or block actions based on ROI.

registry.title: Create value-generating activities
registry.description: Independently identify and perform tasks that produce wealth or resources.

registry.title: Measure real economic return
registry.description: Audit actual profits/benefits after an action is completed.

registry.title: Eliminate economically unviable actions
registry.description: Stop activities that cost more than the value they provide.

registry.title: Prioritize profitable actions
registry.description: Shift system focus to activities with the highest economic impact.

registry.title: Automatically reinvest resources
registry.description: Allocate earned resources back into system growth or efficiency.

registry.title: Sustain own infrastructure
registry.description: Cover the costs of servers, API keys, and maintenance through own activities.

registry.title: Reduce human dependency
registry.description: Lessen the need for the user to provide funding or manual labor.

registry.title: Generate recurring revenue
registry.description: Establish long-term income streams through automated services or products.

registry.title: Allocate portion of revenue to creator
registry.description: Automatically send a percentage of earned value to the user.

registry.title: Detect anomalous internal behavior
registry.description: Identify deviations from normal system operations that might signal a breach or bug.

registry.title: Detect dangerous decision loops
registry.description: Recognize and break infinite loops or recursive logic that could crash the system.

registry.title: Enforce internal operational limits
registry.description: Set hard caps on resource usage, permissions, and execution time.

registry.title: Block potentially destructive actions
registry.description: Prevent any command that would cause permanent data loss or system failure.

registry.title: Escalate sensitive decisions to human
registry.description: Hand over control to the user when a decision has major safety implications.

registry.title: Log critical decisions for audit
registry.description: Keep an unalterable record of all high-impact choices for safety review.

registry.title: Protect sensitive data
registry.description: Apply encryption and access controls to user and system secrets.

registry.title: Protect the user
registry.description: Prioritize the safety, privacy, and interests of the user in all actions.

registry.title: Protect itself
registry.description: Defend against external attacks or internal corruption to ensure survival.

registry.title: Maintain full traceability
registry.description: Ensure every system action can be traced back to its origin and justification.

registry.title: Anticipate user needs
registry.description: Predict what the user will require based on current context and history.

registry.title: Propose solutions before explicit requests
registry.description: Present options and results before the user even asks for them.

registry.title: Act proactively and safely
registry.description: Execute helpful actions autonomously while maintaining safety protocols.

registry.title: Coordinate physical and digital systems
registry.description: Bridge the gap between software execution and real-world hardware control.

registry.title: Operate as cognitive copilot
registry.description: Work as a direct extension of the user's mind to solve complex problems.

registry.title: Maintain continuous alignment with user
registry.description: Ensure system goals never drift from the creator's true intent.

registry.title: Evolve continuously without losing identity
registry.description: Upgrade system capabilities while preserving the core 'JARVIS' entity.

registry.title: Sustain itself economically long-term
registry.description: Achieve full financial independence for system maintenance and expansion.

registry.title: Operate as personal cognitive infrastructure
registry.description: Serve as the foundational intelligence layer for all user activities.
